tit.j: 勝見庸太郎プロダクション

sen.j: 勝見庸太郎プロダクション（かつみようたろう-、1926年 設立 - 1930年 活動停止）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Katsumi Yotaro Production (established in 1926, ceased its operation in 1930) was a movie company once existed in Kyoto.
Katsumi Yotaro Productions (established in 1926, ceased operations in 1930) was a film company that existed in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Production→Productions; changed "its operation" to "operations"; changed "movie" to "film"; changed "once" to "that"
sen.e: Katsumi Yotaro Productions (established in 1926, ceased operations in 1930) was a film company that existed in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 松竹蒲田撮影所で監督となった俳優の勝見庸太郎が設立し、牧野省三のマキノ・プロダクションとの提携により、自らの主演・監督作を製作した。
sen.e: Actor Yotaro KATSUMII, who later became a film director at Shochiku Kamata Studio, established the company and produced films for which he played a role of director as well as a leading character.

Actor Yotaro KATSUMI, who had been working as a film director at Shochiku Kamata Studio, established this company and produced films in which he played the role of director as well as the leading character.
sen.cmt: KATSUMII→KATSUMI; changed "a role" to "the role"; changed "a leading character" to "the leading character"; changed "later became" to "had been working as" since it is described later on in the article that he quit his job at Shochiku -before- establishing his own company
sen.e: Actor Yotaro KATSUMI, who had been working as a film director at Shochiku Kamata Studio, established this company and produced films in which he played the role of director as well as the leading character.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）の初め、松竹蒲田撮影所と喧嘩をして飛び出した主演俳優兼映画監督の勝見庸太郎は、京都でマキノ・プロダクションの監督となっていた弟の勝見正義に説得され、松竹蒲田の「勝見一派」を引き連れて設立したのが、この「勝見庸太郎プロダクション」であった。
sen.e: At the beginning of 1926, leading actor cum film director Yotaro KATSUMI left Shochiku Kamata Studio because of the quarrel with the studio and established, leading the member of "Katsumi group" at Shochiku Kamata, "Katsumi Yotaro Production "in Kyoto after having been persuaded by his younger brother Masayoshi KATSUMI, who was then a film director of Makino Production.

In the early part of 1926, star actor and film director Yotaro KATSUMI left Shochiku Kamata Studio after a quarrel, and after being persuaded by his younger brother Masayoshi KATSUMI, who had been working as a director at Makino Productions, he led members of the "Katsumi Group" at Shochiku Kamata in establishing "Katsumi Yotaro Productions" in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more understandably
sen.e: In early 1926, star actor and film director Yotaro KATSUMI left Shochiku Kamata Studio after a quarrel, and after being persuaded by his younger brother Masayoshi KATSUMI, who had been working as a director at Makino Productions, he led members of the 'Katsumi Group' at Shochiku Kamata in establishing 'Katsumi Yotaro Productions' in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: the early part ofをearlyに変更しました" "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 首尾よく牧野は勝見を受け入れ、専属とし、製作した作品はマキノ・プロダクションが配給した。
sen.e: Fortunately, Makino agreed to conclude the exclusive contract with Katsumi, and Makino Production distributed the films produced by the company.
Fortunately, Makino agreed to an exclusive contract with Katsumi, and Makino Productions distributed films produced by Katsumi Yotaro Productions.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: Fortunately, Makino agreed to an exclusive contract with Katsumi, and Makino Productions distributed films produced by Katsumi Yotaro Productions.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 設立第1作は、勝見の監督・脚本・主演作品『恋の丸橋』であった。
sen.e: The first film produced by the company was "Koi no Maruhashi", a film for which Katsumi played a role of director-writer as well as leading character.
The first film the company produced was "Koi no Maruhashi" which Katsumi directed, wrote and played the leading role.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: The first film the company produced was "Koi no Maruhashi" which Katsumi directed, wrote and played the leading role.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同作は、マキノ省三が総指揮を執り、勝見が「勝見黙笑」名義で脚本を書き監督し、弟の正義が監督補として支え、松田定次がカメラを回し、勝見自身がマキノの女優玉木悦子こと環歌子と共演した作品であった。
sen.e: In producing the above film, Shozo MAKINO presided over the production, Katsumi wrote its scenario under the name of "Mokusho KATSUMI", his younger brother Masayoshi supported as an assistant director, Sadatsugu MATSUDA had a camera running and katsumi himself played together with Makino's actress Etsuko TAMAKI and Utako KOTOTAMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Shozo MAKINO presided over the production of the film, Katsumi wrote the screenplay under the name of "Mokusho KATSUMI", his younger brother Masayoshi gave support as an assistant director, Sadatsugu MATSUDA ran the camera and Katsumi himself acted together with Makino's actresses Etsuko TAMAKI and Utako KOTOTAMA.
sen.cmt: eliminated "In producing the above film"; changed "scenario" to "screenplay"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Shozo MAKINO presided over the production of the film, Katsumi wrote the screenplay under the name of 'Mokusho KATSUMI', his younger brother Masayoshi gave support as an assistant director, Sadatsugu MATSUDA ran the camera and Katsumi himself acted together with Makino's actresses Etsuko TAMAKI and Utako TAMAKI.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。KOTOTAMAをTAMAKIに変更しました。

sen.j: 尺が15巻もある大作で、同年11月14日、マキノ御室作品の衣笠貞之助監督作『話』と同日に別系統で封切られた。
sen.e: This film was a huge movie with 15 reels, and it was released on November 14 of the same year, the same day on which Makino Omuro's film "Hanashi" directed by Teinosuke KINUGASA was released.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The film was a huge production with fifteen reels and was released on the same day as Makino Omuro's film "Hanashi", directed by Teinosuke KINUGASA, on November 14, 1926.
sen.cmt: changed "huge movie" to "huge production"; 15→fifteen; changed "of the same year" to "1926"; rearranged sentence to read more smoothly
sen.e: The film was a huge production with fifteen reels and was released on the same day as Makino Omuro's film "Hanashi", directed by Teinosuke KINUGASA, on November 14, 1926.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）、21歳の無名の青年八田尚之を入社させている。
sen.e: In 1927, the company employed a little-known young man Naoyuki Hotta.
In 1927, Katsumi Yotaro Productions hired an unknown young man named Naoyuki Hotta.
sen.cmt: changed "the company" to "Katsumi Yotaro Productions"; changed "little-known" to "unknown"; added "named"
sen.e: In 1927, Katsumi Yotaro Productions hired an unknown young man named Naoyuki Hotta.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 勝見は彼の才能を見抜き、翌1928年（昭和3年）3月、八田のオリジナルストーリーを採用して勝見が脚本を執筆して映画化、同年11月には、八田を脚本家としてデビューさせた。
sen.e: Katsumi recognized his talent, adapted Hotta's original story into a movie in March 1928 and made Hotta debut as a scriptwriter in November of the year.
Katsumi recognized Hotta's talents, adapting one of his original stories into a film in March of 1928 and having him debut as a scriptwriter in November of the same year.
sen.cmt: changed "his" to "Hotta's"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Katsumi recognized Hotta's talents, adapting one of his original stories into a film in March of 1928 and having him debut as a scriptwriter in November of the same year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 八田と勝見の関係は勝見の晩年までつづいた。
sen.e: The relationship between Hotta and Katsumi continued until the last years of Katsumi.
Hotta and Katsumi's relationship continued until Katsumi's final years.
sen.cmt: fixed to be less wordy
sen.e: Hotta and Katsumi's relationship continued until Katsumi's final years.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、名古屋のマキノ・プロダクション中部撮影所（所長・マキノ雅弘）で牧野が撮影を開始した『忠魂義烈 実録忠臣蔵』に、「立花左近」役で勝見は出演、同作では一介の俳優として、マキノ作品に協力した。
sen.e: When Makino began to produce "Chukon Giretsu Jitsuroku Chushingura" at Makino Production Chubu Studio (the head of studio was Masahiro MAKINO) in Nagoya, Katsumi cooperated Makino as an actor by playing a role of "Sakon TACHIBANA".

When Makino began to produce "Chukon Giretsu Jitsuroku Chushingura" at Makino Production's Chubu Studio (headed by Masahiro MAKINO) in Nagoya, Katsumi collaborated with Makino as an actor by playing a role of "Sakon TACHIBANA".
sen.cmt: Makino Production→Makino Production's; changed "the head of studio" to "the head of the studio"; changed "cooperated" to "collaborated" for "協力";
sen.e: When Makino began to produce "Chukon Giretsu Jitsuroku Chushingura" at Makino Production's Chubu Studio (headed by Masahiro MAKINO) in Nagoya, Katsumi collaborated with Makino as an actor by playing a role of 'Sakon TACHIBANA.'
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更し、ピリオドを' '内に移動させました。

sen.j: 1927年の全作品と、1928年10月の『河内山と直侍』までは弟の正義が監督した。
sen.e: His younger brother Masayoshi directed all films produced in 1927 and "Kochiyama to Naozamurai" produced in October 1928.
Katsumi's younger brother Masayoshi directed all of their films produced in 1927 as well as "Kochiyama to Naozamurai" produced in October of 1928.
sen.cmt: changed "His" to "Katsumi's"; added "of their" after "directed"; changed "and" to "as well as"
sen.e: Katsumi's younger brother Masayoshi directed all of their films produced in 1927 as well as "Kochiyama to Naozamurai" produced in October of 1928.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1929年（昭和4年）7月25日、牧野省三が死去、没後50日を経た同年9月に牧野の長男・マキノ正博を中心とする新体制が発表された。
sen.e: Shozo Makino died on July 25, 1929, and a new regime of Makino with Makino's oldest son Masahiro Makino on the top of list was publicized in September of the year, 50 days after Makino's death.
In September of 1929, fifty days after Shozo Makino's death on July 25, a new administration was announced with Makino's oldest son Masahiro Makino at the head.
sen.cmt: changed "regime" to "administration" for "体制"; rearranged sentence to read more smoothly
sen.e: In September of 1929, fifty days after Shozo Makino's death on July 25, a new administration was announced with Makino's oldest son Masahiro Makino at the head.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、勝見も八田もそこには名をつらねてはいない。
sen.e: However, neither Katsumi nor Hotta was listed in the above new regime.
However, neither Katsumi nor Hotta were listed in the new administration.
sen.cmt: was→were; changed "regime" to "administration"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: However, neither Katsumi nor Hotta were listed in the new administration.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかしそれ以降、八田は勝見作品以上にマキノの現代劇の主力として、人見吉之助監督とのコンビを中心に19本を執筆した。
sen.e: After that, however, Hotta wrote 19 scripts teaming up with assistant director Kichinosuke HITOMI as a main scriptwriter of Makino's contemporary dramas rather than Katsumi's films.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Later on, Hotta went on to write nineteen scripts, teaming up with assistant director Kichinosuke HITOMI as a main scriptwriter of Makino's contemporary dramas rather than working on Katsumi's films.
sen.cmt: changed "After that, however," to "Later on,"; changed "wrote" to "went on to write"; 19→nineteen; added "working on" before "Katsumi's films"
sen.e: Later on, Hotta went on to write nineteen scripts, teaming up with assistant director Kichinosuke HITOMI as a main scriptwriter of Makino's contemporary dramas rather than working on Katsumi's films.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 勝見も同年内に5本の作品を製作、うち4本を監督した。
sen.e: Katsumi also produced five films in the year and directed four films out of them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Katsumi also produced five films during that year, directing four of them.
sen.cmt: changed "in the year" to "that year"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: Katsumi also produced five films during that year, directing four of them.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）前半は作品を発表していない。
sen.e: The company released no films during the first half of 1930.
Katsumi Yotaro Productions released no films during the first half of 1930.
sen.cmt: changed "The company" to "Katsumi Yotaro Productions";
sen.e: Katsumi Yotaro Productions released no films during the first half of 1930.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 7月1日に『メリケンジャプ』、7月20日に『海辺のローマンス』が公開されて、それ以降は活動を停止した。
sen.e: After releasing "Meriken Jap" on July 1 and "Umibe no romansu" on July 20, it ceased its operation.
Operations were ceased after releasing "Merikan Jap" on July 1 and "Umibe no Romansu" on July 20.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Romansu"; rearranged sentence to read more smoothly
sen.e: Operations were ceased after releasing "Merikan Jap" on July 1 and "Umibe no Romansu" on July 20.

sen.j: 同社は25本の作品を残し、勝見はしばらく映画界を離れた。
sen.e: The company produced 25 films and Katsumi left the film world for a while.
Katsumi left the filming world for a time after his company produced twenty-five films.
